question: Direction (68-73): Choose the correct option: Direct speech of: I asked her why she was sad is
prashna: निर्देश (68-73): सही विकल्प चुनें: 'I asked her why she was sad' का प्रत्यक्ष कथन है:

options.A: I told her, "Why you sad are ?"
options.B: I said to her, "Why sad you are ?"
options.C: I said to her, "Why are you sad ?"
options.D: I telling her, "Why you sad are ?"

vikalpa.A: मैंने उससे कहा, "क्यों तुम दुखी हो?"
vikalpa.B: मैंने उससे कहा, "क्यों दुखी तुम हो?"
vikalpa.C: मैंने उससे कहा, "तुम दुखी क्यों हो?"
vikalpa.D: मैं उसे कह रहा हूँ, "क्यों तुम दुखी हो?"

question: Direct speech of: Ramesh asked me where I was going is
prashna: 'Ramesh asked me where I was going' का प्रत्यक्ष कथन है:

options.A: Ramesh said to her, "Where is she going?"
options.B: Ramesh said to me, "Where are you going?"
options.D: Ramesh will say, "Where do you go ?"

vikalpa.A: रमेश ने उससे कहा, "वह कहाँ जा रही है?"
vikalpa.B: रमेश ने मुझसे कहा, "तुम कहाँ जा रहे हो?"
vikalpa.C: रमेश कहता है, "तुम कहाँ जाते हो?"

question: Direct speech of: She wished that I might be happy is
prashna: 'She wished that I might be happy' का प्रत्यक्ष कथन है:

options.A: She said to me, "May you be happy !"
options.C: She will say, "Happy you may be."
options.D: She may say, "You may be happy."

vikalpa.C: वह कहेगी, "खुश तुम हो सकते हो।"
vikalpa.D: वह कह सकती है, "तुम खुश हो सकते हो।"

question: Indirect speech of: Rohan said to me, "Please give me a book.” is
prashna: 'Rohan said to me, "Please give me a book."' का अप्रत्यक्ष कथन है:

options.A: Rohan requests me to give a book him.
options.B: Rohan asked me to give a book to him.
options.C: Rohan requested me to give him a book.
options.D: Rohan may request me for a book.

vikalpa.C: रोहन ने मुझसे उसे एक किताब देने का अनुरोध किया।
vikalpa.D: रोहन मुझसे एक किताब के लिए अनुरोध कर सकता है।

options.B: He will say that he was ruined
options.C: He says that he can be ruined
